variant.question: Hydraulic pressure for flight deck indications is measured by:

options.text: transducer connected to an indirect indicator.
diaphragm connected to an accumulator.
bellows connected to a bourdon tube.
aneroid capsule connected to a direct indicator.

variant.question: Hydraulic pressure for flight deck indications is measured by:

options.text: a transducer connected to an indirect indicator.
an aneroid capsule connected to a direct indicator.
a bellows connected to a bourdon tube.
a diaphragm connected to an accumulator.

variant.question: The flap load relief system..

options.text: Retracts the flaps when the airspeed is becoming too high and exceeds a certain limit.
Extends the slats automatically when the angle of attack becomes too high.
Extends the flaps automatically when the angle of attack becomes too high.
Blocks the flaps in the current position when a flap asymmetry is detected.

variant.question: You have lost your main hydraulic brake source. On most large and modern transport aeroplanes what system will take over and enables you to brake?

options.text: An alternate hydraulic system.
Braking parachute.
Thrust reverser.
Accumulators only.

variant.question: After losing the normal hydraulic system that powers the brakes on most large transport aeroplanes, the alternate supply is provided by...

options.text: another hydraulic system.
accumulators only.
pneumatic pressure.
manual actuation of the brakes.

variant.question: After losing the normal hydraulic system that powers the brakes on most large transport aeroplanes, the alternate supply is provided by

options.text: another hydraulic system.
accumulators only.
pneumatic pressure.
manual actuation of the brakes.

variant.question: How is hydraulic pressure sensed?

options.text: By a transducer that receives an electric signal from a remote pressure sensor.
By an aneroid capsule that receives a pneumatic signal from the hydraulic reservoir.
By a diaphragm that receives a hydraulic signal from the accumulator.
By bellows via mechanical sensing from a Bourdon tube.

variant.question: How is hydraulic pressure sensed?

options.text: By a Bourdon tube.
By bellows via mechanical sensing from a Bourdon tube.
By a diaphragm via hydraulic sensing from an accumulator.
By several aneroid capsules.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: The climb limited take-off mass is independent of the wind component.
The accelerate stop distance required is independent of the runway condition.
The take-off distance with one engine out is independent of the wind component.
The field-length-limited take-off mass is independent of the wind component.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: A stopway means an area beyond the take-off runway, able to support the aeroplane during an aborted take-off.
If a clearway or a stopway is used, the liftoff point must be attainable at least at the end of the permanent runway surface.
A clearway is an area beyond the runway which can be used for an aborted take-off.
An underrun is an area beyond the runway end which can be used for an aborted take-off.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: Differences training requires the acquisition of additional knowledge and training on an appropriate training device or the aircraft.Familiarisation training requires the acquisition of additional knowledge.
Differences training requires the acquisition of additional training on an appropriate training device or the aircraft.Familiarisation training requires the acquisition of additional knowledge.
Differences training and familiarisation training are both the same.

Differences training requires the acquisition of additional knowledge.Familiarisation training requires the acquisition of additional knowledge and training on an appropriate training device or the aircraft.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: Normally atmospheric pressure stops falling rapidly behind a warm front, the air temperature rises.
At warm fronts thunderstorms are often observed.
Cumulus clouds and a good visibility are normally observed in a warm sector in winter.
Cumulus clouds and a good visibility are normally observed in a warm sector in autumn.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: Normally atmospheric pressure stops falling rapidly behind a warm front, the air temperature rises.
At warm fronts thunderstorms are often observed.
Cumulus clouds and a good visibility are normally observed in a warm sector in winter.
Cumulus clouds and a good visibility are normally observed in a warm sector in autumn.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: As the angle of attack increases, the stagnation point on the aerofoil's profile moves downwards on the profiles leading edge.
The stagnation point is always situated on the chord line, the centre of pressure is not.
The stagnation point is another name for centre of pressure.
The centre of pressure is the point on the aerofoil leading edge where the airflow splits up.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: VR is the speed at which the pilot should start to rotate the aeroplane.
VR should not be higher than 1.05 VMCG.
VR is the speed at which, during rotation, the nose wheel comes off the runway.
VR should not be higher than V1.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: Psychosomatic means that mental and/or emotional stressors can be manifested in physical reactions.
Psychosomatic means that a physical problem is always followed by psychological stress.
A psychosomatic disorder is a disease that involves the mind only.
Psychosomatic complaints hardly occur in professional aviation because of the strict selection for this particular profession.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: Short term memory is affected by interruptions.
Motivation does not affect performance.
All motivators (both physical and mental) are subjective.
Extreme “achievement” motivation is an ideal attribute for a Captain of an aircraft.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: Dynamic stability is possible only when the aeroplane is statically stable about the relevant axis.
Static stability means that the aeroplane is also dynamically stable about the relevant axis.
Dynamic stability means that after being displaced from original equilibrium condition, the aeroplane will return to that condition without oscillation.
A dynamically stable aeroplane would be almost impossible to fly manually.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: Airframe icing can occur in clear air.
Haze is a reduction of visibility due to the presence of water vapour.
Above the tropopause no turbulence occurs.
Mountain waves are always accompanied by rotor clouds.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: The maximum clearway that can be used is limited to 50% of the TORA making the TODA 150% of the TORA.
If any clearway is present it must be reduced to no greater distance than the stopway.
The TORA is 50% of the TODA as a declared distance making the TORA 1.5 times the TODA.
The TODA is always longer than the TORA.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: Stressors at home can add to the effects of the stressors in the cockpit.
People experience stress in a similar way.
Stress has no or only minor effects on cardiovascular disease.
The effect of stress is only negative.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: Scotopic Vision is vision through the operation of the Rods.
Scotopic Vision is vision through the operation of the Cones.
Scotopic Vision is the same as Photopic Vision.
Photopic Vision is the same as Peripheral Vision.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: Short term overcurrent is normal.
Any overcurrent is abnormal.
None of the statements are correct.
Overcurrent is normal.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: The Bergeron-Findeisen process is mainly based on the difference of maximum vapour pressure over water and over ice of the same temperature.
At mid-latitudes the coalescence process is usually the initial process in the formation of precipitation.
In the tropics stratiform precipitation does not occur.
The principle of the Bergeron-Findeisen process is mainly based on the difference in size of the cloud elements.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: At the equator horizontal motions do not induce any horizontal Coriolis force
In gradient wind the Coriolis force is in balance with the horizontal pressure gradient force and the frictional force
The Coriolis force is inversely proportional to the sine of latitude
The Coriolis force is directed in the same sense at all latitudes

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: Short term overcurrent is normal.
Protective devices must trip as soon as a overcurrent is detected.
Overcurrent is normal.
Any overcurrent is abnormal.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: A climb limited takeoff is performance limited.
An aircraft is not obligated to be able to perform a takeoff with a failure of the critical power unit for certification purposes.
A climb limited takeoff is operational limited.
A performance limited takeoff is where factors such as passenger load distribution limit the RTOM.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: It is hard to detect low-level clouds with only infra-red image.
Infra-red images are only suitable for daytime observation.
Both visible and infra-red images can easily detect low level clouds or fog.
Visible images have the lowest quality.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text:
Normally atmospheric pressure stops falling rapidly
behind a warm front, the air temperature rises.

At warm fronts thunderstorms are often
observed.

Cumulus clouds and a good visibility are normally
observed in a warm sector in autumn.

Cumulus clouds and a good visibility are normally
observed in a warm sector in winter.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: FG is reported only when visibility is reduced by water droplets or ice crystals to less than 1 000 m.
HZ is reported only when visibility is reduced to 2 000 m or less.
When BR is reported then the visibility is more than 1 000 m but less than 8 000 m.
VC denotes not at the aerodrome but within 8 NM.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: The decisions pilots make in the cockpit remain valid for a limited time only.
During the course of a flight, pilots should always reach a decision as quickly as possible.
Decision-making becomes an automatic process for experienced pilots.
Any decision made by pilots in the cockpit can NOT be reversed.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: Hydraulic fluids are considered incompressible and often cause irritation to the skin and eyes.
Mineral-based hydraulic fluid is dyed purple for identification purposes.
Hydraulic fluids are interchangeable when the compressibility ratio of both is the same.
Hydraulic fluids have a high viscosity because one purpose is also to lubricate the pumps and actuators.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: The urgency communications have priority over all the other communications, except distress.
ATC clearances have the same priority as urgency communications.
There is no difference regarding priority between distress communications and urgency communications.
The urgency communications have priority over all the other communications.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: A stopway is an area beyond the end of TORA able to support the aeroplane mass during an abandoned take-off.
A clearway is an area beyond the runway end which can be used for an abandoned take-off.
A declared safe area is an area beyond the runway end which can be used for an abandoned take-off.
If a clearway or a stopway is used in the take-off calculations, the lift-off point may be beyond the end of TORA.

Mountain waves are always accompanied by rotor
clouds

water vapour

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: The Maximum Landing Mass of an aeroplane is restricted by structural limitations, performance limitations and the strength of the runway.
The Basic Empty Mass is equal to the mass of the aeroplane excluding Traffic Load and usable fuel but including the crew.
The Maximum Take-off Mass is equal to the maximum mass when leaving the ramp.
The Maximum Zero Fuel Mass ensures that the centre of gravity remains within limits after the uplift of fuel.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: A tail heavy aeroplane is less stable and stalls at a lower speed than a nose heavy aeroplane
The lowest stalling speed is obtained if the actual centre of gravity is located in the middle between the aft and forward limit of centre of gravity.
If the actual centre of gravity is located behind the aft limit of centre of gravity it is possible that the aeroplane will be unstable, making it necessary to increase elevator forces.
If the actual centre of gravity is close to the forward limit of the centre of gravity the aeroplane may be unstable, making it necessary to increase elevator forces.
